item.title: Capital Punishment
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Bowser jr:

What barbaric country do you live in, that make people sit and do nothing in a room for 20 years. I’m pretty sure such treatment would constitute as torture. Two wrong doesn’t make right. If you think killing someone is unforgivable you would not use that as a penalty. If you think death penalty is OK, you say that some murder is forgiveable and your death penalty argument fall apart.

It just seems like a pretty unfair trade to me - you kill someone, and you are jailed (or let off in this country!). Jails are not like superman’s troll obviously. A lot of shows document the jails, and they do have things to do and meals to eat. They even develop their own communication systems and whatnot. Also, a lot of felons commit more crimes after they are released from jail.

Perhaps it could be up to the victim’s family what would happen to the murderer? Just a thought, and of course by this I mean non-accidental. Some people forgive murder, while other’s want revenge. I guess that’s kind of unfair as well though.
